questions.question: In representation models that take document length into account, the main goal is to ...
options: Normalize term weights to prevent long documents from dominating similarity.
Assign higher weight to documents only for having more words.
Give more value to long documents because they contain more terms.
Automatically determine term relevance without calculating TF or IDF.

questions.question: ¿Qué modelo de representación es más fácil de programar?
options: TF-IDF.
TF.
Matriz de incidencia término-documento.
Todas son iguales de programar.

questions.question: Indicate the INCORRECT option about an information retrieval (IR) model [D,Q,F,R(qi,dj)]:
options: D represents the logical views of the documents.
R(qi,dj) is not a matching or ranking function.
It is not the same as a representation model.
Q represents the logical views of the user queries.

questions.question: Information retrieval can only be applied to text.
options: True: only to text.
False: it can also be applied to images, audio, video, medical data, signals, etc.

questions.question: In IR, the global reference is associated with ...
options: None of the other options.
The term-document incidence matrix.
The inverse document frequency (IDF).
The frequency of a term within a document (TF).

questions.question: In the term-document incidence matrix ...
options: The value 1 indicates the absence of the term in the associated document.
Each row corresponds to a document and each column to a term.
It assigns the frequency of occurrence of each term in each document.
The value 1 indicates the presence of the term in the associated document.

questions.question: The conjunctive component of terms refers to ...
options: The joint representation of all terms that characterize a document.
The joint representation of all terms that characterize a query.
The joint representation of all terms that characterize a document or a query.
None of the other options.

questions.question: In information retrieval (IR), the local reference is associated with ...
options: The frequency of a term within a document (TF).
The number of documents in the collection in which a term appears.
The relationship between document length and term importance.
None of the other options.

questions.question: In information retrieval ...
options: Recall(exhaustividad) measures how many retrieved documents are relevant.
Precision(especificidad) measures how many retrieved documents are relevant.
Recall(exhaustividad) measures the proportion of relevant documents that are retrieved.
Precision(especificidad) measures the proportion of relevant documents that are retrieved.

questions.question: TF-IDF weighting combines ...
options: The frequency of a term in a document and the frequency of the term in the collection.
The frequency of a term in a document and the inverse frequency of the term in the collection.
The inverse frequency of a term in a document and the inverse frequency of the term in the collection.
The inverse frequency of a term in a document and the frequency of the term in the collection.
